description: Internal alterations incorporating removal of partition walls (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.      Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun | All original features and fittings, as indicated on the approved plans, shall be retained as such. Any further modifications would require the submission of a Listed Building Consent application.     Reason:  To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 4.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2011). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.     Reason: To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building and the Bedford Park Conservation Area, in accordance with policy 4.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, the Bedford Park Conservation Area Management Plan (September 2007) and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2011).
